columns.name: Cards
columns.reason: Found S2 (primary specialty) with 1=Cardiologist and S2a (type of doctor's office) with 1=Cardiologist → original expression explicitly checks S2 or S2a for cardiologists, so mapped to (S2 == 1 | S2a == 1).

alternatives.reason: qSPECIALTY has 1=CARD and could serve as a higher-level specialty flag, but is a recoded/alternate specialty variable compared with S2.
qCARD_SPECIALTY uses 1=CARD (with other grouped codes) and may indicate cardiology but appears to be a grouped recode rather than the primary specialty variable.
SPEC_DESC is a captured descriptor that may contain 'Cardiologist' text, but free-text or captured descriptor matching can be inconsistent.

uncertainties: Multiple variables contain 'cardiologist' (S2, S2a, qSPECIALTY, qCARD_SPECIALTY) — confirm which variable(s) should be authoritative for the 'Cards' cut.
S2a records office type; confirm whether including office-type (S2a == 1) as a specialty indicator is intended.

columns.name: PCPs
columns.reason: Found S2 with 2=Internal Medicine / General Practitioner / Primary Care / Family Practice → original expression uses S2=2 to identify PCPs, so mapped to S2 == 2.

alternatives.reason: qSPECIALTY has 2=PCP and could be used as a specialty flag, but is a recoded/alternate variable.
S2a (office type) has 2=Internal Medicine / GP / Primary Care / Family Practice and could identify PCPs based on practice setting.
B5r3 is a 0/1 flag for 'Primary Care' training and may overlap with PCP categorization but is a different question.
B5r4 is a 0/1 flag for 'Family Practice' and may capture a subset of PCPs but is not identical to S2==2.

uncertainties: Confirm whether 'PCPs' should include Nurse Practitioners (S2 == 6) or Physician’s Assistants (S2 == 7), or whether it should be strictly S2 == 2.
Multiple variables (S2, S2a, qSPECIALTY, B5r3/B5r4) capture primary care concepts — confirm preferred authoritative variable.

columns.name: Other
columns.reason: Found S2 with 3=Nephrologist,4=Endocrinologist,5=Lipidologist → original expression explicitly selects these S2 codes, so mapped to S2 %in% c(3,4,5).

alternatives.reason: S2 contains a 99=Other code which might be intended by the column label 'Other', but the original expression explicitly selected 3,4,5 and did not include 99.

columns.name: Physician
columns.reason: Found S2 with specialty codes 1-5 corresponding to physician specialties → Selected S2 because the original expression explicitly referenced S2 values 1-5 to define physicians.

columns.name: APP
columns.reason: Found S2a ('type of doctor's office') and the original expression explicitly referenced S2a → Selected S2a to reflect the original expression, but S2a==1 maps to 'Cardiologist' which is inconsistent with the label 'APP' (Advanced Practice Provider); alternatives more plausibly capturing APP are S2 (6=NP,7=PA) or S2b (2=NP,3=PA).

alternatives.reason: S2 has explicit codes 6=Nurse Practitioner and 7=Physician’s Assistant which directly map to APP.
S2b ('primary role') codes include 2=Nurse Practitioner and 3=Physician’s Assistant, directly indicating APP.
qSPECIALTY groups NP/PA under 3=NPPA which aligns to APP but is a higher-level grouping variable.

uncertainties: Original expression S2a==1 maps to 'Cardiologist' not APP; confirm whether 'APP' was intended to mean Advanced Practice Provider (NP/PA).
If APP refers to NP/PA, confirm whether to use S2 (codes 6/7) or S2b (codes 2/3) or qSPECIALTY==3 for reporting and which takes precedence.

columns.name: 150+ (Higher)
columns.reason: Found S11 ('Of those adult patients... how many have a confirmed diagnosis of hypercholesterolemia with established cardiovascular disease (CVD)') → S11 directly matches 'Volume of ASCVD Patients'; interpreted '150+' as S11 >= 150.

columns.name: 20-149 (Lower)
columns.reason: Found S11 ('Of those adult patients... how many have a confirmed diagnosis of hypercholesterolemia with established cardiovascular disease (CVD)') → S11 directly matches 'Volume of ASCVD Patients'; mapped '20 - 149' to an inclusive range (S11 >= 20 & S11 <= 149).

columns.name: Tier 1
columns.reason: Found qLIST_TIER with value labels '1=TIER 1,2=TIER 2,3=TIER 3,4=TIER 4' → selected because it explicitly matches 'Tier 1 from list'; other tier-like variables were found but lack label detail.

alternatives.reason: LEQ_TIER exists and name suggests a tier concept but no value labels provided in the data map; mapping to 1 is an assumption.
FINAL_FACILITY_TIER may represent facility-level tiering but has no labels in the data map; code mapping is uncertain.
FINAL_SOC_TIER may represent SOC-level tiering but has no labels in the data map; code mapping is uncertain.

uncertainties: Multiple 'TIER' variables found: qLIST_TIER (with explicit 1-4 labels), LEQ_TIER, FINAL_FACILITY_TIER, FINAL_SOC_TIER (latter three lack label definitions). Confirm intended variable.
Confirm that qLIST_TIER codes 1-4 correspond to Tier 1-4 for this banner use.
If a different tier variable (e.g., LEQ_TIER) is intended, provide its value labels.

bannerCuts.groupName: Currently Prescribe Leqvio without a Statin and Before Other Therapies

columns.name: Yes
columns.reason: Found exact variables A3ar1c2 ('Without a statin - Leqvio') and A3br1c1 ('BEFORE any other lipid-lowering therapy - Leqvio') → Both exist in the data map and the expression intends to select respondents with positive values for both, so mapped to (A3ar1c2 > 0 & A3br1c1 > 0).

columns.name: No
columns.reason: Found exact variables A3ar1c2 and A3br1c1 → Mapped to the logical negation of the Yes condition to capture respondents who do not meet both >0 criteria, so mapped to !(A3ar1c2 > 0 & A3br1c1 > 0).

bannerCuts.groupName: Leqvio Rx'ing Would Increase with New PCSK9s Indication

columns.name: All Leqvio Prescribing
columns.reason: Found A4r2c2 and A4r2c1 in the data map → exact variable names match (NEXT 100 and LAST 100 Leqvio prescribing), so a direct comparison A4r2c2 > A4r2c1 implements the intended increase check.

columns.name: Leqvio Rx'ing without a Statin & Before Other Therapies
columns.reason: Found A3ar1c2, A4ar1c2, A4br1c1 and A3br1c1 in the data map → all are exact variable matches for the 'without a statin' and 'before any other therapy' Leqvio metrics, so implemented the composite condition checking those three criteria.

columns.name: Academic / Univ. Hospital
columns.reason: Found S9 exactly in the data map; value label 6 = 'Academic/University Hospital', matching the banner expression S9=6.

columns.name: Total Community
columns.reason: Found S9 exactly in the data map; value labels 1-5 correspond to community practice settings, matching the banner expression S9=1 OR S9=2 OR S9=3 OR S9=4 OR S9=5.
